Description: Upper section of a glazed steatite shabti of Padiamenipt with a lappet-wig, a carved face, crossed hands in low relief holding the two hoes, the body inscribed with Chapter 6 of The Book of The Dead in four(surviving) rows of incised hieroglyphs, the upper back is decorated with two incised representations of seed-baskets.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore
